util

Class ByteUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.ByteUtils

  • public class ByteUtils
extends Object
    This is a utility class for doing byte related operations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static long bytesToLong(byte[] bytes)
      Convert a byte array into a long using ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN as the byte order.
      static long getLong(InputStream input)
      Read a long out of the given input stream (reading out the number bytes in a long and converting).
      static byte[] getRandomBytes(int length)
      Creates a byte array 'length' long and populates it with random data.
      static byte[] longToBytes(long x)
      Convert a long into a byte array using ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN as the byte order.
      static byte[] readBytes(InputStream input)
      Read all the bytes from the input stream and return as a single byte array.
      static byte[] readBytes(InputStream input, int length)
      Read 'length' bytes from the input stream and return as a single byte array 'length' long.
      static byte[] readLengthPrefixedData(InputStream input)
      This will read a long from the input stream.
      static void writeLengthPrefixedData(byte[] data, OutputStream outputStream)
      This will first write out the length of the data as a long (in bytes) followed by the data itself.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ByteUtils

        public ByteUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • bytesToLong

        public static long bytesToLong(byte[] bytes)
        Convert a byte array into a long using ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN as the byte order.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to convert into a long
        Returns:
        a long representation of the bytes

      • getLong

        public static long getLong(InputStream input)
                    throws IOException
        Read a long out of the given input stream (reading out the number bytes in a long and converting).
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream to read from
        Returns:
        the long read out of the input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there was an error reading the bytes

      • getRandomBytes

        public static byte[] getRandomBytes(int length)
        Creates a byte array 'length' long and populates it with random data. The JCE is used for the random data (SecureRandom).
        Parameters:
        length - the size of the random byte array
        Returns:
        a byte array 'length' long with random data

      • longToBytes

        public static byte[] longToBytes(long x)
        Convert a long into a byte array using ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN as the byte order.
        Parameters:
        x - the long to convert into a byte array
        Returns:
        the long as a byte array

      • readBytes

        public static byte[] readBytes(InputStream input,
                               int length)
                        throws IOException
        Read 'length' bytes from the input stream and return as a single byte array 'length' long.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream to read bytes from
        length - the number of bytes to read from the input stream
        Returns:
        a byte array 'length' long with the bytes read from the input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there are any issues reading the bytes from the input stream

      • readBytes

        public static byte[] readBytes(InputStream input)
                        throws IOException
        Read all the bytes from the input stream and return as a single byte array.
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream to read bytes from
        Returns:
        a byte array with all the bytes read from the input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there are any issues reading the bytes from the input stream

      • readLengthPrefixedData

        public static byte[] readLengthPrefixedData(InputStream input)
                                     throws IOException
        This will read a long from the input stream. The read long becomes the 'length'. It will the read 'length' bytes from the input stream. The read bytes will be returned as a single byte array.
        Parameters:
        input - the stream to read from
        Returns:
        a byte array with the specified amount of data
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there are any errors reading the data from the stream

      • writeLengthPrefixedData

        public static void writeLengthPrefixedData(byte[] data,
                                           OutputStream outputStream)
                                    throws IOException
        This will first write out the length of the data as a long (in bytes) followed by the data itself.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to write out
        outputStream - the stream to write to
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there are any errors writing the data to the stream
